articles.title: Chicago crime: Teen killed, 8 injured in Loop shootings on State Street, near Dearborn, Monroe, police, Mayor Johnson say - ABC7 Chicago
articles.description: Chicago police said seven teens ranging in age from 13 to 17 were shot in the Loop Friday night, just steps from ABC7's studios. A separate shooting nearby left a 14-year-old dead, Mayor Johnson said.

articles.description: At least five families say their babies were treated for infant botulism after consuming ByHeart formula months before a current outbreak was detected. More than 30 babies have been treated for the rare and life-threatening disease in an outbreak that started…

aiSummary:
Today's top headlines reveal a complex mix of geopolitical tensions, domestic political maneuvering, and pressing social concerns, alongside developments in sports and entertainment. On the international stage, a proposed U.S. peace plan for Ukraine drew sharp condemnation from American senators, with one calling it a major geopolitical mistake. Simultaneously, tensions flared between Japan and China as Japan blasted China's "baseless" claims regarding a Taiwan crisis, calling for dialogue to prevent spiraling ties. Domestically, the White House is acknowledging "bumps" and making "course corrections" amid Republican grumbling, while a high-profile prosecution involving Comey appears to be struggling due to a series of missteps.

Key risks and concerns include the potential for continued global instability, particularly regarding the Ukraine conflict and rising friction in the Asia-Pacific region. Domestically, the White House faces ongoing political pressures, and the potential failure of a significant legal case could have broader implications. A particularly urgent concern is the surge in urban violence, exemplified by multiple shootings in Chicago's Loop that left one teenager dead and several others, mostly teens, injured.

In other notable developments, college football saw live updates from the USC vs. Oregon game and a recap of Oklahoma's victory over Missouri. NBA veteran Chris Paul hinted at his potential retirement, while actress Selma Blair shared a positive update on her battle with Multiple Sclerosis. Actor Josh Hutcherson also discussed his career resurgence and prospects for returning to the "Hunger Games" franchise.
